tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditional - Finished T123 at 2015 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament
tourBios.carHigh:
2014: Played in 11 events on the Mackenzie Tour and made eight cuts with five top-25 finishes...After an opening-round 72 at the SIGA Dakota Dunes Open, rebounded with rounds of 67-69-65 to finish T10...Had a strong weekend at The Players Cup with rounds of 70-70 to finish T16...Added two more top-25 finishes in consecutive weeks at the Forces and Families Open (T14) and The Great Waterway Classic (T16), where he carded eight under-par rounds in a row...Held the 54-hole lead at the Tour Championship Canada by two strokes, but a final-round 71 included a bogey the 72nd hole to miss out on a playoff. He settled for a T2 finish.

 2013: Did not make a Web.com Tour start. 

 2012: Missed the cut in his only two starts of the year, at the Chile Classic and BMW Charity Pro-Am. 

2011: Made the cut in 10 of 24 starts during his rookie Web.com Tour season...Only top-10 finish was a T3 at the Pacific Rubiales Bogota Open, which was ultimately reduced to 36 holes because of repeated weather delays. 2010: Missed the cut at the Stadion Athens Classic at UGA, his only career Web.com Tour start prior to the 2011 season...Was runner-up on the Canadian Tour, at the Canadian Tour Championship. Shot weekend rounds of 67-65 to tie with four others, six shots behind winner Aaron Goldberg...Earlier in the year, was T5 at the Dakota Dunes Open, thanks to a third-round 63. 

2009: Made eight Canadian Tour starts, earning his first runner-up finish, at the Desjardins Montreal Open. Began the event with a 63 then reeled off rounds of 68-689-67 to finish four strokes behind winner Stuart Anderson...Only other top-20 came at the Roxul Jane Rogers Championship (T18).

 2008: Had two top-10s in nine Canadian Tour starts. Finished T4 at the Saskatchewan Open, shooting a final-round 63 to move up the leaderboard...Was a T9 at the Jane Rogers Championship, with a 68-66-68 performance over his final 54 holes.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: All-Big Ten first-team selection in 2008. Won two collegiate events. Won the 2007 and 2005 Minnesota Golf Championship.
tourBios.personal: Lists Rod Cook and Andrew Tank as his instructors...Biggest thrill in golf was his first hole-in-one...Favorite teams are the Minnesota Golden Gophers and Minnesota's professional teams, the Vikings, Wild and Twins. Favorite TV show is "Swamp People," and his top movies are "Fast Five" and "Grumpy Old Men."..Favorite book is The Bible. Favorite food is pizza. Dallas, Atlanta and Scottsdale, Arizona, are his favorite cities to visit...Never travels without his iPod...First car was a 1985 Camaro...Would round out his dream foursome with dad, uncle and grandpa...Is afraid of heights...Carries beef jerky in his golf bag.

tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Finished fifth at the Mackenzie Tour Qualifying School in Oak Valley to earn his exempt status...Posted T38 in season's first start at the PC Financial Open...Finished T8, with four sub-par rounds at the Syncrude Boreal Open...Continued to improve with a T4 at the Staal Foundation Open in Thunder Bay...Capitalized on solid rounds of 68-67-64-67 to earn a solo third at the National Capital Open to Support Our Troops, two strokes out of the Sam Ryder-Taylor Pendrith playoff...Finished 20th on the Order of Merit to earn an exemption into the second stage of the Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament.

2014: Finished fifth at the California Qualifying Tournament to earn status...Posted four top-25 finishes over his first 11 starts of the season, then took a two shot lead into the final round of the Freedom 55 Financial Championship before finishing T2...Earned the chance to play in not only his first major championship, the U.S. Open (T63). 

2013: Did not make a Web.com Tour start. 

2012: Missed the cut in his only two starts of the year, at the Chile Classic and BMW Charity Pro-Am. 

2011: Made the cut in 10 of 24 starts during his rookie Web.com Tour season...Only top-10 finish was a T3 at the Pacific Rubiales Bogota Open, which was ultimately reduced to 36 holes because of repeated weather delays. 

2010: Missed the cut at the Stadion Athens Classic at UGA, his only career Web.com Tour start prior to the 2011 season...Was runner-up on the Canadian Tour, at the Canadian Tour Championship. Shot weekend rounds of 67-65 to tie with four others, six shots behind winner Aaron Goldberg...Earlier in the year, was T5 at the Dakota Dunes Open, thanks to a third-round 63. 

2009: Made eight Canadian Tour starts, earning his first runner-up finish, at the Desjardins Montreal Open. Began the event with a 63 then reeled off rounds of 68-68-67 to finish four strokes behind winner Stuart Anderson...Only other top-20 came at the Roxul Jane Rogers Championship (T18).

2008: Had two top-10s in nine Canadian Tour starts. Finished T4 at the Saskatchewan Open, shooting a final-round 63 to move up the leaderboard...Was a T9 at the Jane Rogers Championship, with a 68-66-68 performance over his final 54 holes.

Favorite TV show is "Swamp People," and his top movies are "Fast Five" and "Grumpy Old Men."...Favorite book is The Bible. Favorite food is pizza. Dallas, Atlanta and Scottsdale, Ariz., are his favorite cities to visit...Never travels without his iPod...First car was a 1985 Camaro...Would round out his dream foursome with dad, uncle and grandpa...Says he's afraid of heights...Carries beef jerky in his golf bag.

dyn.dynResults: He has finished 2nd on the Mackenzie Tour-PGA T 3 times.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks 25th in Scoring Average (Actual) on the Mackenzie Tour-PGA TOUR Canada.
